law.catch_line: Disarming a peace officer -- Penalty -- Applicability.

text.section:
A person is guilty of disarming a peace officer when he intentionally:
Removes a firearm or other deadly weapon from the person of a peace officer when the peace officer is acting within the scope of his official duties; or
Deprives a peace officer of the officer's use of a firearm or deadly weapon when the peace officer is acting within the scope of his official duties.
Disarming a peace officer is a Class D felony.

The provisions of this section shall not apply when:
The defendant does not know or could not reasonably have known that the person disarmed was a peace officer; or
The peace officer was, at the time of the disarming or incident thereto, engaged in felonious conduct.

law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 606, sec. 123, effective July 15, 1998.
